text: The East Lancs Lolyne was a double-decker body of a bus. It had a low floor. It was built from 1999 to 2007 by East Lancashire Coachbuilders. It was only built on the Dennis Trident 2 chassis. East Lancs misspelled bus names on purpose (naming it "Lolyne" instead of "Lowline", "lollin'" or "loin"") ==Myllennium Lolyne== The East Lancs Myllennium Lolyne was a double-decker body of a bus. It was built from 2002 to 2007 by East Lancashire Coachbuilders. It was only built on the Dennis Trident 2 chassis. ==Related pages== * For the single decker, see East Lancs Myllennium * For the double- deck body on DAF DB250 chassis, see East Lancs Myllennium Lowlander * For the double-deck body on Volvo B7TL, see East Lancs Myllennium Vyking * For the double-deck body on Volvo B9TL, see East Lancs Myllennium Nordic ==References== ==Other websites== * Lolyne Category:Double-decker buses Category:Low-floor buses
title: East Lancs Lolyne
